'''Evolution items''' are special items that can be bought from [[Shops]], and some may be found in the [[Underground]] or dropped as [[Rare hold items|rare hold items]]. These items can be used to evolve certain Pokémon, and are the only way to obtain the evolved forms of these Pokémon. = How to Use = In the Start Menu, navigate to the Items page and select an evolution item. A list of the obtained Pokémon that the item can be used on will be displayed. A red Pokéball symbol on the Pokémon means its evolution has already been obtained. If the Pokéball symbol is yellow, the shiny form of that Pokémon's evolution has been obtained. By selecting a Pokémon and clicking '''''Use evolution stones!''''', that item will be used on the selected Pokémon to evolve it. You might need to scroll down to see the Green Use Evolution Stones button. There is a base \frac{1}{2048} chance that the evolved form will be [[Shiny Chance|Shiny]]. =Regions= When bought in shops, all evolution items cost 2500 [[Quest Points]] {{Questpoints}}. '''Legend:''' *First usable: the earliest region this item can be used to evolve Pokémon *Mine layout: layout that the stones can be found on the [[underground}} *Acquisition: where the item can be purchased (city and town shops) / mined (Underground) / won ([[Battle Frontier]]) *Pre-evolutions: which Pokémon the item can be used on *Evolved forms: the resulting Pokémon after evolution via item use. '''Evolution items''' are special items that can be bought from [[Shops]], and some may be found in the [[Underground]] or dropped as [[Rare hold items|rare hold items]]. These items can be used to evolve certain Pokémon, and are the only way to obtain the evolved forms of these Pokémon. = How to Use = In the Start Menu, navigate to the Items page and select an evolution item. A list of the obtained Pokémon that the item can be used on will be displayed. A red Pokéball symbol on the Pokémon means its evolution has already been obtained. If the Pokéball symbol is yellow, the shiny form of that Pokémon's evolution has been obtained. By selecting a Pokémon and clicking '''''Use evolution stones!''''', that item will be used on the selected Pokémon to evolve it. You might need to scroll down to see the Green Use Evolution Stones button. There is a base \frac{1}{2048} chance that the evolved form will be [[Shiny Chance|Shiny]]. =Regions= When bought in shops, all evolution items cost 2500 [[Quest Points]] {{Questpoints}}. '''Evolution items''' are special items that can be bought from [[Shops]], and some may be found in the [[Underground]] or dropped as [[Rare hold items|rare hold items]]. These items can be used to evolve certain Pokémon, and are the only way to obtain the evolved forms of these Pokémon. = How to Use = In the Start Menu, navigate to the Items page and select an evolution item. A list of the obtained Pokémon that the item can be used on will be displayed. A red Pokéball symbol on the Pokémon means its evolution has already been obtained. If the Pokéball symbol is yellow, the shiny form of that Pokémon's evolution has been obtained. By selecting a Pokémon and clicking '''''Use evolution stones!''''', that item will be used on the selected Pokémon to evolve it. You might need to scroll down to see the Green Use Evolution Stones button. There is a base \frac{1}{2048} chance that the evolved form will be [[Shiny Chance|Shiny]]. =Regions= When bought in shops, all evolution items cost 2500 [[Quest Points]] {{Questpoints}}. '''Evolution items''' are special items that can be bought from [[Shops]], and some may be found in the [[Underground]] or dropped as [[Rare hold items|rare hold items]]. These items can be used to evolve certain Pokémon, and are the only way to obtain the evolved forms of these Pokémon. = How to Use = In the Start Menu, navigate to the Items page and select an evolution item. A list of the obtained Pokémon that the item can be used on will be displayed. A red Pokéball symbol on the Pokémon means its evolution has already been obtained. If the Pokéball symbol is yellow, the shiny form of that Pokémon's evolution has been obtained. By selecting a Pokémon and clicking '''''Use evolution stones!''''', that item will be used on the selected Pokémon to evolve it. You might need to scroll down to see the Green Use Evolution Stones button. There is a base \frac{1}{2048} chance that the evolved form will be [[Shiny Chance|Shiny]]. =Regions= When bought in shops, all evolution items cost 2500 [[Quest Points]] {{Questpoints}}. '''Evolution items''' are special items that can be bought from [[Shops]], and some may be found in the [[Underground]] or dropped as [[Rare hold items|rare hold items]]. These items can be used to evolve certain Pokémon, and are the only way to obtain the evolved forms of these Pokémon. = How to Use = In the Start Menu, navigate to the Items page and select an evolution item. A list of the obtained Pokémon that the item can be used on will be displayed. A red Pokéball symbol on the Pokémon means its evolution has already been obtained. If the Pokéball symbol is yellow, the shiny form of that Pokémon's evolution has been obtained. By selecting a Pokémon and clicking '''''Use evolution stones!''''', that item will be used on the selected Pokémon to evolve it. You might need to scroll down to see the Green Use Evolution Stones button. There is a base \frac{1}{2048} chance that the evolved form will be [[Shiny Chance|Shiny]]. =Regions= When bought in shops, all evolution items cost 2500 [[Quest Points]] {{Questpoints}}. '''Evolution items''' are special items that can be bought from [[Shops]], and some may be found in the [[Underground]] or dropped as [[Rare hold items|rare hold items]]. These items can be used to evolve certain Pokémon, and are the only way to obtain the evolved forms of these Pokémon. = How to Use = In the Start Menu, navigate to the Items page and select an evolution item. A list of the obtained Pokémon that the item can be used on will be displayed. A red Pokéball symbol on the Pokémon means its evolution has already been obtained. If the Pokéball symbol is yellow, the shiny form of that Pokémon's evolution has been obtained. By selecting a Pokémon and clicking '''''Use evolution stones!''''', that item will be used on the selected Pokémon to evolve it. You might need to scroll down to see the Green Use Evolution Stones button. There is a base \frac{1}{2048} chance that the evolved form will be [[Shiny Chance|Shiny]]. =Regions= When bought in shops, all evolution items cost 2500 [[Quest Points]] {{Questpoints}}. '''Evolution items''' are special items that can be bought from [[Shops]], and some may be found in the [[Underground]] or dropped as [[Rare hold items|rare hold items]]. These items can be used to evolve certain Pokémon, and are the only way to obtain the evolved forms of these Pokémon. = How to Use = In the Start Menu, navigate to the Items page and select an evolution item. A list of the obtained Pokémon that the item can be used on will be displayed. A red Pokéball symbol on the Pokémon means its evolution has already been obtained. If the Pokéball symbol is yellow, the shiny form of that Pokémon's evolution has been obtained. By selecting a Pokémon and clicking '''''Use evolution stones!''''', that item will be used on the selected Pokémon to evolve it. You might need to scroll down to see the Green Use Evolution Stones button. There is a base \frac{1}{2048} chance that the evolved form will be [[Shiny Chance|Shiny]]. =Regions= When bought in shops, all evolution items cost 2500 [[Quest Points]] {{Questpoints}}.
